golden-triangle-tour.title: Golden Triangle of Odisha Tour
golden-triangle-tour.description: Explore the rich heritage, vibrant culture, and serene landscapes of Odisha through its Golden Triangle - Bhubaneswar, Konark, and Puri.
golden-triangle-tour.longDescription: Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The ethnic culture of Odisha makes you visit all the places that are rich in culture, heritage and ethnicity. It also includes a trip to the dense woods which is the resident of many tribes living in Odisha. They consist of ethical gestures, art, handicrafts, mythologies and the ancient music which is amazing and full of life. Experience the medieval ages in the modern times and walk back into the world of vegetative and cultural Odisha. Odisha's Tribal Tour showcases famous tribes like Bondos, Didayis, Koyas, and Kondhs. Home to over 62 tribes, which constitute 29% of its population, Odisha offers a glimpse into unique tribal life, including their festivals, food, attire, music, and dance. Odisha is known as the homeland of simple down-to-earth tribes. The land of Odisha is rich in culture and tradition. The untouched beauty of tribal areas and their vibrant culture make Odisha Tribal Tours truly captivating.

jagannath-dham-darshan.title: Jagannath Dham Darshan
jagannath-dham-darshan.location: Bhubaneswar, Konark, Puri, Satapada, Odisha, India
jagannath-dham-darshan.description: A spiritually enriching journey through Odisha’s sacred cities—Bhubaneswar, Puri, Konark, and Satapada—featuring temples, beaches, heritage, and dolphins.
jagannath-dham-darshan.longDescription: Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The ethnic culture of Odisha makes you visit all the places that are rich in culture, heritage and ethnicity. It also includes a trip to the dense woods which is the resident of many tribes living in Odisha. They consist of ethical gestures, art, handicrafts, mythologies and the ancient music which is amazing and full of life. Experience the medieval ages in the modern times and walk back into the world of vegetative and cultural Odisha. The Golden Triangle of Odisha—Bhubaneswar, Puri, and Konark—offers a captivating blend of ancient temples, coastal beauty, and vibrant culture. Perfect for travelers seeking spiritual solace, architectural grandeur, and scenic vistas, this iconic circuit is a treasure trove of experiences.

tribal-tour.title: Tribal Tour
tribal-tour.description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant cultures of Odisha's indigenous tribes in this unique ethnographic journey.
tribal-tour.longDescription: Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The ethnic culture of Odisha (Orissa) makes you visit all the places that are rich in culture, heritage and ethnicity. It also includes a trip to the dense woods which is the resident of many tribes living in Odisha (Orissa). They consist of ethical gestures, art, handi-crafts, mythologies and the ancient music which is amazing and full of life. Experience the medieval ages in the modern times and walk back into the world of vegetative and cultural Odisha. Odisha's Tribal Tour showcases famous tribes like Bondos, Didayis, Koyas, and Kondhs. Home to over 62 tribes, which constituents 29% of its population. Odisha offers a glimpse into unique tribal life, including their festivals, food, attire, music, and dance. Odisha is known as the homeland of simple down to earth tribes. The land of Odisha is rich in culture and tradition. The untouched beauty of tribal areas and their vibrant culture make Odisha Tribal Tours truly captivating.

shakti-peeth.title: Shakti Peeth
shakti-peeth.description: A spiritual pilgrimage to Odisha's powerful Shakti Peethas - seats of the Divine Feminine.
shakti-peeth.longDescription:
Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The Goddess has been worshiped in India since Vedic times. Scriptures say everything emanates from her. She is the source of Shakti. The beginning and the end….The Whole creation lives in her. Shakti is a concept or personification of the divine feminine creative power, sometimes referred to as “the Great Divine Mother” in Hinduism.

This Goddess Shakti, the Goddess of power, is said to be the complete incarnation of the Adi Shakti. Shakti is the presiding deity of the Shaktas, one of the three streams of Hinduism.

Some of the great religious texts like the Shiva Purana, the Devi Bhagavata, the Kalika Purana and the Astashakti recognize Bimala (Paada Khanda or feet) inside the Jagannath Temple in Puri and Tara Tarini (Stana Khanda or breasts) at Purnagiri near Berhampur in Odisha.

The Biraja Temple or Girija Kshetra, Oddiyana Peetha is believed to be another Shakti Peetha in Odisha. An Oddiyana is an ornament worn by women around her navel. According to Tantra Chudamani, Sati’s navel fell in Utkala (old name of Odisha) and is known as Biraja Kshetra. Sri Adi Shankara in his Astadasha Shakti Peetha stuti describes the Goddess as Girija.

temple-tours.title: Temple Tours
temple-tours.description: A sacred journey through Odisha's most architecturally significant temples.
temple-tours.longDescription: Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The ethnic culture of Odisha (Orissa) makes you visit all the places that are rich in culture, heritage and ethnicity. It also includes a trip to the dense woods which is the resident of many tribes living in Odisha (Orissa). They consist of ethical gestures, art, handi-crafts, mythologies and the ancient music which is amazing and full of life. Chilika Lake, Asia's largest saltwater lagoon, is renowned for its biodiversity and peaceful waters. Located near Odisha's Golden Triangle, which includes Bhubaneswar, Puri, and Konark, these two iconic destinations offer a unique mix of cultural heritage and natural beauty. The Golden Triangle with Chilika Lake tour is perfect for travelers seeking both history and tranquility in one unforgettable journey.

textile-tourism.title: Textile Tourism
textile-tourism.description: A colorful journey through Odisha's textile traditions - from ikat to temple textiles.
textile-tourism.longDescription: This textile-focused tour takes you to the heart of Odisha's weaving villages. Witness the intricate processes behind Sambalpuri ikat, Bomkai, and other traditional textiles. Meet master weavers, try your hand at natural dyeing, and build your own textile collection with expert guidance. The tour includes visits to off-loom weaving centers and rare textile collections.

adventure-tour-plan.title: Adventure Tour Plan
adventure-tour-plan.description: Thrilling adventures across Odisha's diverse landscapes - from disappearing beaches to mighty waterfalls.
adventure-tour-plan.longDescription: Odisha (formerly Orissa), an eastern Indian state on the Bay of Bengal, is known for its tribal cultures and its many ancient Hindu temples. The ethnic culture of Odisha (Orissa) makes you visit all the places that are rich in culture, heritage and ethnicity. It also includes a trip to the dense woods which is the resident of many tribes living in Odisha (Orissa). They consist of ethical gestures, art, handi-crafts, mythologies and the ancient music which is amazing and full of life. Experience the medieval ages in the modern times and walk back into the world of vegetative and cultural Odisha. Odisha's Tribal Tour showcases famous tribes like Bondos, Didayis, Koyas, and Kondhs. Home to over 62 tribes, which constituents 29% of its population. Odisha offers a glimpse into unique tribal life, including their festivals, food, attire, music, and dance. Odisha is known as the homeland of simple down to earth tribes. The land of Odisha is rich in culture and tradition. The untouched beauty of tribal areas and their vibrant culture make Odisha Tribal Tours truly captivating.
includes: All transfers and sightseeing by Personalized AC Car
All Toll tax, parking fees & driver allowances
Private Boat: - For Chilika Lake Tour (If Chilika is present in the Itinerary)
excludes: Entrance fees to monuments and museum
Other meals not mentioned laundry, telephone calls, and incidentals.
Any personal expenses. Room service and special orders. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.
Any expense arising due to unforeseen circumstances is not included.

itineraryDays.title: Cultural Exploration of Barogadaba Tribe
activities: Explore villages of Gotalpara and Dural
Experience Goter festival, Dhemsa dance, and local traditions
Return to hotel and overnight stay

itineraryDays.title: Adventure at Deomali Peak
activities: Enjoy valley views and return to hotel

itineraryDays.title: Spiritual Journey to Gupteswar
activities: Visit ancient caves and traditional Dhuruba villages
Return to Jeypore for overnight stay
